page.title: 15Communication
page.content: The main source of communications in the area is the telephone. The people in the area who do not have a telephone use the postal service for communications, although there are not many post boxes or post offices in the area. The public call boxes are also few. The postman calls round Elberton and area twice a week to collect and deliver post. He rides a bicycle for transport. The average number of people with a telephone in the area is about 90%. The data used was gathered by ten children who questioned the farmers and residents of the area.
